definition: Fu Mingxia (1978-), Chinese diving champion
to lean over/to fall (go down)/to hide (in ambush)/to conceal oneself/to lie low/hottest days of summer/to submit/to concede defeat/to overcome/to subdue/volt
surname Fu
Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
rose-tinted sky or clouds at sunrise or sunset

sentences.english: Fu Ming Xia became a big star after she won the gold medal for diving.
sentences.chinese: 伏明霞获跳水冠军后便成了大明星。

sentences.english: Fu Mingxia became the first Chinese woman with 5 career medals.
sentences.chinese: 伏明霞成为中国首位拥有5枚奥运金牌的女选手。

sentences.english: Fu Mingxia is a graceful "diving queen". ;
sentences.chinese: 伏明霞是个举措精彩的“跳水王后”。

sentences.english: So Fu Mingxia has the best gift for her 14th birthday.
sentences.chinese: 伏明霞为她14岁生日赢得了最好的礼物。

sentences.english: Fu Mingxia became the youngest Olympic champion at the age of 14.
sentences.chinese: 伏明霞年仅14岁时就成为最年轻的奥运冠军。
